document.docAuthor: Correia, Filipe R., Guedes-Silva, Elkênita & Souza-Filho, Jesser F.
document.docTitle: Ampithoe suapensis Correia, Guedes-Silva & Souza-Filho, 2016, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Ampithoe Leach, 1814 (Senticaudata, Ampithoidae) from Brazilian coast

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Ampithoe Leach, 1814 (Senticaudata, Ampithoidae) from Brazilian coast

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. Holotype : male ( 3.5 mm , dissected and drawn, 4 slides), Est 2 C - 3 , Suape Beach (
8 ° 23 ′03.31′′S
–
34 ° 57 ′ 20.64 ′′W
), Pernambuco, Brazil , in macroalgae in the intertidal zone in Beachrock reefs,
July 2009
, TNV Reis et al., MOUFPE 15513 .

Paratypes :
1 female
( 2.9 mm , dissected and drawn, 1 slide), Est 2 C - 3 , Suape Beach (
8 ° 23 ′03.31′′S
–
34 ° 57 ′ 20.64 ′′W
), Pernambuco, Brazil , in macroalgae in the intertidal zone in Beachrock reefs,
July 2009
, TNV Reis et al., MOUFPE
15514. 133
males and 1703 females, a batch of 39 samples, Suape Beach (
8 ° 23 ′03.31′′S
–
34 ° 57 ′ 20.64 ′′W
), Pernambuco, Brazil , in macroalgae in the intertidal zone in Beachrock reefs,
July 2009
, TNV Reis et al., MOUFPE
15515. 52
males and
671 females
, a batch of 32 samples, Suape Beach (
8 ° 23 ′03.31′′S
–
34 ° 57 ′ 20.64 ′′W
), Pernambuco, Brazil , in macroalgae in the intertidal zone in Beachrock reefs,
October 2009
, TNV Reis et al., MOUFPE
15516. 11
males and
23 females
, a batch of 16 samples, Suape Beach (
8 ° 23 ′03.31′′S
–
34 ° 57 ′ 20.64 ′′W
), Pernambuco, Brazil , in macroalgae in the intertidal zone in Beachrock reefs,
January 2010
, TNV Reis et al., MOUFPE
15517. 48
males and
123 females
, a batch of 21 samples, Suape Beach (
8 ° 23 ′03.31′′S
–
34 ° 57 ′ 20.64 ′′W
), Pernambuco, Brazil , in macroalgae in the intertidal zone in Beachrock reefs,
April 2010
, TNV Reis et al., MOUFPE 15518 .

Type locality.
Suape Beach, Cabo de Santo Agostinho, Pernambuco, Brazil .

Diagnosis. Lower lip with lateral lobe longer than medial lobe. Maxilla 1 inner plate without row of slender setae. Mandible with palp short and slender. Gnathopod 1 carpal lobe subacute; carpus shorter than propodus; palm entire, without midmedial spine, with a robust setae defining palm; dactylus subequal in length to palm. Gnathopod 2 basis anterodistal lobe large and rounded, with 5 slender setae; carpus shorter than propodus; propodus palm extremely acute, entire, without midmedial spine, occupying almost entire posterior margin, and densely setose; dactylus shorter in length to palm. Pereopod 3 and 4 basis narrow; merus narrow. Pereopods 5 strongly prehensile; merus subrectangular. Uropod 1 peduncle distoventral process present and blunt. Uropod 3 peduncle with 4 distal robust setae, outer ramus subequal to inner ramus, without patch of small conical lateral denticles; inner ramus with 2 distal robust setae. Telson distally truncate, apical cusps small.

Description. Based on Holotype male 3.5 mm , MOUFPE 15.513 . Head 1.2 × longer than deep. Mandible molar with 4 or 5 robust setae in the accessory setal row; palp slender, short, article 2 longer than article 3 ( 1.2 ×), article 3 longer than article 1 (2.0 x) with 3 slender setae apically. Lower lip mandibular lobe with curved margins, subacute apically.
Maxilla 1
palp with 8 apical robust setae, inner plate lacking setae.
Maxilla 2
inner plate narrower than outer. Maxilliped outer plate with reduced setation (robust setae small).

Pereon.
Gnathopod 1
without densely setose margins; coxa less deep than gnathopod 2 coxa, anteroventral angle produced, distoventral margin rounded, anterior margin concave, ventral margin with a row of small setules; basis longer than coxa, with sparse slender setae, posterodistal lobe small and truncate, with 2 slender seta; merus produced to form a small, rounded distoventral lobe, anterior margin with setae absent; carpus longer than merus, subtriangular, anterior margin with slender setae only; propodus narrow (length 2.5 × width), subrectangular; palm with a small denticle and 1 defining robust seta; dactylus inner margin denticulate.
Gnathopod 2
coxa ventral margin with a row of small setules; basis longer to coxa, with 2 slender setae on posterior margin; merus produced to form a short, subacute distoventral lobe, anterior margin with 1 seta present; carpus subequal to merus, subtriangular, anterior margin with 2 slender setae only; propodus broad (length 2.0 × width), ovoid, not produced into an anterodistally setose lobe; dactylus tapering evenly, acute, inner margin denticulate.
Pereopod 5
basis with marginal slender setae; distal articles slender; propodus slightly expanded distally, subrectangular, with 4 distal simple striated robust setae; dactylus strongly curved. Pereopods 6–7 missing.

Pleon.
Uropod 2
peduncle with 3 robust setae, setal fringe absent; outer ramus shorter than inner ramus; inner ramus with 3 marginal and 3 apical robust setae, slender setae absent; outer ramus with 8 marginal robust setae, slender setae absent.
Uropod 3
peduncle longer than broad ( 2.2 × width), long with respect to the rami length ( 2.2 ×), marginal robust setae absent, with 2 marginal slender setae, with 6 distal slender setae; inner ramus with 1 distal slender seta.
Telson
with apical slender and plumose setae.

Female (sexually dimorphic characters). Based on paratype , female, 2.9 mm , MOUFPE 15.514 .
Gnathopod 1
subequal in size to gnathopod 2 ; coxa subequal in size to gnathopod 2 coxa; basis shorter than coxa; merus not produced to form a short, subacute distoventral lobe; carpus shorter than propodus ( 0.89 ×); propodus subrectangular; palm with midmedial spine.
Gnathopod 2
basis posterodistal lobe small and round, with 1 slender seta; carpus longer than merus, shorter than propodus ( 0.6 ×); propodus narrow (length 2.3 x width); palm acute without tooth defining palm, defined by 1 robust seta.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1.
Ampithoe suapensis
sp. nov.
, holotype, male (3.5 mm), habitus and mouthparts, Suape Beach (8°23’03.31”S – 34°57’20.64”W), Pernambuco, Brazil, MOUFPE 15513. Scale bars = 1 mm.

FIGURE 2.
Ampithoe suapensis
sp. nov.
, holotype, male (3.5 mm), gnathopods 1–2, pereopods 3–4, Suape Beach (8°23’03.31”S–34°57’20.64”W), Pernambuco, Brazil, MOUFPE 15513. Paratype, Female (2.9 mm), gnathopods 1–2, Suape Beach (8°23’03.31”S–34°57’20.64”W), Pernambuco, Brazil, MOUFPE 15514.Scale bars = 1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Etymology. The species is named
suapensis
in reference to its type locality – Suape Beach, Pernambuco, Brazil .

Distribution. Known only from the type locality, Suape Beach (
8 ° 23 ′03.31′′S
–
34 ° 57 ′ 20.64 ′′W
), Cabo de Santo Agostinho, Pernambuco, Brazil .

Remarks.
Ampithoe suapensis
sp. nov.
, in having a distoventral process on the peduncle of uropod 1 , is related to
A. divisura
Shoemaker, 1933
,
A. kava
Myers, 1985
,
A. kaneohe
Barnard, 1970
,
A. kaneohe navosa
Barnard, 1970
,
A. poipu (
Barnard, 1970
)
,
A. meganae
Peart, 2007
,
A. parakava
Peart, 2007
,
A. rotunda
Peart, 2007
. However,
A. suapensis
sp. nov.
differs from
A. divisura , A. kava
and
A. parakava
mainly in the shape of propodus of male gnathopod 2 , which is ovoid with palm acute, entire and lacking blunt process defining palm. It is separated from
A. meganae
in having short palp of mandible, gnathopod 2 basis lacking robust setae on anterodistal lobe, propodus palm not defined by spine or robust setae, pereopod 5 propodus with 4 robust setae ( vs. only one).

Ampithoe supensis
sp. nov.
can be distinguished from
A. kaneohe
Barnard, 1970
and
A. kaneohe navosa (
Myers, 1985
)
, by the male gnathopod 2 propodus lacking a long tuft of setae near anterodistal angle, palm densely setose ( vs. weakly setose). It also differs from
A. rotunda
in having short palp of mandible, a less developed anterodistal lobe in the basis of male gnathopod 2 , propodus palm not defined by spine, and in lacking robust setae on anterior margin of pereopod 5 .
